alert.note: Alert for Lackawanna; Pike; Wayne (Pennsylvania) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Binghamton (South Central New York and Northeastern Pennsylvania)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued July 27 at 5:35PM EDT until July 27 at 11:00PM EDT by NWS Binghamton
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 745 PM EDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...A portion of northeast Pennsylvania, including the following counties, Lackawanna, Pike, Wayne and Wyoming. * WHEN...Until 745 PM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Water over roadways. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 533 PM EDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in In and around Clarks Summit. Between 1 and 3 inches of rain have fallen. - Areas in and around Clarks Summit and near Blakely have reported minor flooding with water on the roads and some instances of basement flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Scranton, Carbondale, Honesdale, Tunkhannock, Waverly, Falls, Dunmore, Archbald, Dickson City, Olyphant, Clarks Summit, Mayfield, Clarks Green, Waymart, Dalton, Hawley, Factoryville, La Plume, Prompton and Bethany. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
